GraphCreation

Class BarabasiAlbertGraphGenerator

  • java.lang.Object
    • GraphCreation.GraphLoader
      • GraphCreation.BarabasiAlbertGraphGenerator
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    GeneratedGraph

    public class BarabasiAlbertGraphGenerator
extends GraphLoader
implements GeneratedGraph
    Graph Generator using the BarabasiAlbert model. Wrapped from JUNG. Supports both UNDIRECTED and DIRECTED graphs BarabasiAlbert is an evolving scale-free random graph generator. At each time step, a new vertex is created and is connected to existing vertices according to the principle of "preferential attachment", whereby vertices with higher degree have a higher probability of being selected for attachment
    Author:
    MOREPOWER

        public BarabasiAlbertGraphGenerator(int initialVerts,
                            int addedEdgesPerStep,
                            int totalSteps,
                            edu.uci.ics.jung.graph.util.EdgeType graphType)
        Initial variable setters needed to run the Generator.
        Parameters:
        initialVerts - - initial verts to be added without connection to the graph.
        addedEdgesPerStep - - edges added per step, for all steps leading, a random generator will be used
        totalSteps - - the amount of additional vertexes and edge additions that will be added
        graphType -
